intro: Staehelinia alpina, commonly known as the alpine staehelinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cold, dry conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Staehelinia alpina is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
